intro.description: This cheat sheet will show you how to create a grid job description.

item.title: Open the g-Eclipse user perspective
item.description: If you are not already in the g-Eclipse user perspective, in the main menu select Window > Open Perspective > g-Eclipse (User) or click on the "Click to Perform" link below.

item.title: Create your job description file using the g-Eclipse Grid Job Wizard.
item.description:
Select File > New > Job Description. (Alternatively, you may right-click in the Grid Project view and choose New > Job Description.) This wizard will generate a file in the Job Submission Description Language (JSDL).
Choose the 'Job Description' folder of your Grid Project and type in the name you would like to give your jsdl file.
Click Next.

item.title: Specify the executable.
item.description:
Choose the executable you would like to run in your job by locating it with the Browse button. Here, you can also give your job a name and a short description.
Click Next.

item.title: Specify the input files.
item.description:
Choose the input files required by your executable by clicking on Add file... to add it to the list.
If your executable requires no input files, leave the list empty. Click Next.

item.title: Specify the output files.
item.description:
Choose the output files produced by your executable by clicking Add file... to add it to the list. You can specify multiple output files with associated settings.
If your executable produces no output files, leave the list empty. Click Next.

item.title: Specify Environment Variables
item.description:
Specify any Environment Variables required for the job to run.
Click Finish to complete the wizard. Verify that your new jsdl file is in the 'Job Description' folder in your Grid Project.
